title: What is the Meaning of Alchemy and How is it Related to Science?
first_phrase: This text discusses the intersections of different levels of meaning and laws, which can be synthesized into distinct systems of knowledge and action. It refers to the sense of alchemy, which reduces to the physical application of metaphysical knowledge to transform substances. The author clarifies that the alchemy of interest is the physical one, and it has an opposite method to that of empirical observation. In the last 200 tokens, the author emphasizes the need for the operator to be within the work and have realized the image of it. Additionally, the author highlights that while modern chemistry is simply physical, alchemy is both physical and metaphysical, encompassing possible knowledge of forces and influences that also act in the psychic and organic reality of human beings, making it susceptible to various practical applications.

last_phrase: In conclusion, alchemy is a science that utilizes the method of identifying the meeting of the inner and outer, the intellectual and the real. It is both a physical and metaphysical discipline that seeks to transmute not only substances but also the human being. While exploring the expressions of Hermetic philosophers, it is important to consider both the literal and symbolic meanings and recognize the principles that guide their writings.
